dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependencies.name: py-matplotlib

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy
dependencies.name: py-statsmodels

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
CryoDRGN is a neural network based algorithm for heterogeneous cryo-EM
reconstruction. In particular, the method models a continuous
distribution over 3D structures by using a neural network based
representation for the volume
dependent_to.name: cryodrgn

dependent_to.description:
HybPiper was designed for targeted sequence capture, in which DNA
sequencing libraries are enriched for gene regions of interest,
especially for phylogenetics. HybPiper is a suite of Python scripts that
wrap and connect bioinformatics tools in order to extract target
sequences from high-throughput DNA sequencing reads
dependent_to.name: hybpiper

dependent_to.description: IsoQuant: Transcript discovery and quantification with long RNA reads
dependent_to.name: isoquant

dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.
dependent_to.name: py-abipy

dependent_to.description:
Python utilities to interact with Darshan log records of HPC
applications.
dependent_to.name: py-darshan

dependent_to.description:
dRep is a python program for rapidly comparing large numbers of genomes.
dRep can also "de-replicate" a genome set by identifying groups of
highly similar genomes and choosing the best representative genome for
each genome set.
dependent_to.name: py-drep

dependent_to.description:
Python package for generation of protein sequences and evolutionary
alignments via discrete diffusion models
dependent_to.name: py-evodiff

dependent_to.description:
A scalable software framework for reinforcement learning environments
and agents/policies used for the Design and Control applications
dependent_to.name: py-exarl

dependent_to.description:
geoplot is a high-level Python geospatial plotting library. It's an
extension to cartopy and matplotlib which makes mapping easy: like
seaborn for geospatial.
dependent_to.name: py-geoplot

dependent_to.description: A toolbox for accurate single-trial estimates in fMRI time-series data.
dependent_to.name: py-glmsingle

dependent_to.description:
inStrain is python program for analysis of co-occurring genome
populations from metagenomes that allows highly accurate genome
comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and
sensitive SNP detection with gene localization and synonymous non-
synonymous identification.
dependent_to.name: py-instrain

dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)
dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis

dependent_to.description:
Multi-class imbalance is a common problem occurring in real-world
supervised classifications tasks. While there has already been some
research on the specialized methods aiming to tackle that challenging
problem, most of them still lack coherent Python implementation that is
simple, intuitive and easy to use. multi-imbalance is a python package
tackling the problem of multi-class imbalanced datasets in machine
learnin
dependent_to.name: py-multi-imbalance

dependent_to.description: Common workflows for MRI (anatomical, functional, diffusion, etc)
dependent_to.name: py-niworkflows

dependent_to.description: Graph Neural Network for neutrino physics event reconstruction
dependent_to.name: py-nugraph

dependent_to.description:
PhyloPhlAn 3.0 is an integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic
profiling of genomes and metagenomes.
dependent_to.name: py-phylophlan

dependent_to.description:
pyani is a Python3 module that provides support for calculating average
nucleotide identity (ANI) and related measures for whole genome
comparisons, and rendering relevant graphical summary output. Where
available, it takes advantage of multicore systems, and can integrate
with SGE/OGE-type job schedulers for the sequence comparisons.
dependent_to.name: py-pyani

dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.
dependent_to.name: py-pyomo

dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.
dependent_to.name: py-scanpy

dependent_to.description:
Variants of the synthetic minority oversampling technique (SMOTE) for
imbalanced learning
dependent_to.name: py-smote-variants

dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.
dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem

dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.
dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics

dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.
dependent_to.name: py-wub

dependent_to.description: N-D labeled arrays and datasets in Python
dependent_to.name: py-xarray

dependent_to.description: Rapid large-scale prokaryote pan genome analysis
dependent_to.name: roary

dependent_to.description:
Survey is a high level performance tool product from Trenza, Inc. The
survey collector/analytics framework is a new generation, high level,
lightweight multiplatform Linux tool set that targets metric collection
for high level performance analysis of applications running on both
single node and on large scale platforms, including the Cray platforms.
The collector is designed to work on sequential, MPI, OpenMP, and hybrid
codes and directly leverages several interfaces available for tools
inside current MPI implementations including: MPICH, MVAPICH, MPT, and
OpenMPI. It also supports multiple architectures and has been tested on
machines based on Intel, AMD, ARM, and IBM P8/9 processors and
integrated AMD and NVIDIA GPUs. Survey is a licensed product with the
source not openly available. To access the survey source and build with
spack please contact: Trenza Inc. via: dmont@trenzasynergy.com or
jeg@trenzasynergy.com
dependent_to.name: survey

description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
name: py-seaborn

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
